intro: Bignonia unguis-cati var. exoleta, commonly known as the yellow bell vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its long, yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and can grow as a vine or shrub. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
